summary: js-for-compiler.html#types should mention {Object?} and {?Object} equivalence, if true

comments.content:
Thanks for your comment.  "?Object"/"!Object" is the preferred form.  The "Object?
"/"Object!" form is deprecated. 

If the intent was to have base.js updated, it should be filed against closure-library.

Yes, the ES4 specification changed while we were implementing it. {?Object} is the 
correct form. {Object?} is deprecated.

It is likely that we will remove support for {Object?} in some time in the future. But 
if we did, we would provide a script for auto-converting all the existing annotations.
